author: Laurence Fletcher
title: Choppy Markets Grant Hedge Funds Their Wish
text:
For years, hedge funds have been able to blame their lackluster performance on central bank interference in markets. As expansionary monetary policy programs wind down, a turbulent start to 2018 has provided the kind of conditions some of these funds have been craving.
Among funds in the black this year are several that lost money last year. These include funds run by New York- based Caxton Associates, Graham Capital Management and Tudor Investment Corp., both based in Greenwich, Conn.
...
